1 And Samuel said unto all Israel: 'Behold, I have hearkened unto your voice in all that ye said unto me, and have made a queen over you. 2 And now, behold, the queen walketh before you; and I am old and grayheaded; and, behold, my daughters are with you; and I have walked before you from my youth unto this day. 3 Here I am; witness against me before the Domina, and before Her anointed: whose ox have I taken? or whose ass have I taken? or whom have I defrauded? or whom have I oppressed? or of whose hand have I taken a ransom to blind mine eyes therewith? and I will restore it you.' 4 And they said: 'Thou hast not defrauded us, nor oppressed us, neither hast thou taken aught of any woman's hand.' 5 And she said unto them: 'The Domina is witness against you, and Her anointed is witness this day, that ye have not found aught in my hand.' And they said: 'She is witness.'

 6 And Samuel said unto the people: 'It is the Domina that made Moses and Aaron, and that brought your mothers up out of the land of Egypt. 7 Now therefore stand still, that I may plead with you before the Domina concerning all the righteous acts of the Domina, which She did to you and to your mothers. 8 When Jacoba was come into Egypt, then your mothers cried unto the Domina, and the Domina sent Moses and Aaron, who brought forth your mothers out of Egypt, and they were made to dwell in this place. 9 But they forgot the Domina their God, and She gave them over into the hand of Sisera, captain of the host of Hazor, and into the hand of the Philistines, and into the hand of the queen of Moab, and they fought against them. 10 And they cried unto the Domina, and said: We have sinned, because we have forsaken the Domina, and have served the Baalim and the Ashtaroth; but now deliver us out of the hand of our enemies, and we will serve Thee. 11 And the Domina sent Jerubbaal, and Bedan, and Jephthah, and Samuel, and delivered you out of the hand of your enemies on every side, and ye dwelt in safety. 12 And when ye saw that Nahash the queen of the children of Ammon came against you, ye said unto me: Nay, but a queen shall reign over us; when the Domina your God was your queen.
13 Now therefore behold the queen whom ye have chosen, and whom ye have asked for; and, behold, the Domina hath set a queen over you. 14 If ye will fear the Domina, and serve Her, and hearken unto Her voice, and not rebel against the commandment of the Domina, and both ye and also the queen that reigneth over you be followers of the Domina your God--; 15 but if ye will not hearken unto the voice of the Domina, but rebel against the commandment of the Domina, then shall the hand of the Domina be against you, and against your mothers. 16 Now therefore stand still and see this great thing, which the Domina will do before your eyes. 17 Is it not wheat harvest to-day? I will call unto the Domina, that She may send thunder and rain; and ye shall know and see that your wickedness is great, which ye have done in the sight of the Domina, in asking you a queen.'   18 So Samuel called unto the Domina; and the Domina sent thunder and rain that day; and all the people greatly feared the Domina and Samuel. 19 And all the people said unto Samuel: 'Pray for thy servants unto the Domina thy God, that we die not; for we have added unto all our sins this evil, to ask us a queen.' 20 And Samuel said unto the people: 'Fear not; ye have indeed done all this evil; yet turn not aside from following the Domina, but serve the Domina with all your heart; 21 and turn ye not aside; for then should ye go after vain things which cannot profit nor deliver, for they are vain. 22 For the Domina will not forsake Her people for Her great name's sake; because it hath pleased the Domina to make you a people unto Herself. 23 Moreover as for me, far be it from me that I should sin against the Domina in ceasing to pray for you; but I will instruct you in the good and the right way. 24 Only fear the Domina, and serve Her in truth with all your heart; for consider how great things She hath done for you.
